00024 #ifndef CONSTANTS_H_
00025 #define CONSTANTS_H_
00026 #include "types.h"
00027 
00028 //The Current Version of Code. Dump files and other
00029 //configs will have to be consistent with this version
00030 //for their use
00031 static const double CURRENT_VERSION = 1.1;
00032 
00033 //Num of tokens in flight which is specified for TBB
00034 static const size_t NUM_SAMPLERS = 50000;
00035 
00036 //Used to do upfront memory reservation for the updates vector
00037 //which is the vehicle used to transport msgs from the sampler
00038 //to the updater
00039 static const size_t EXP_NUM_WORDS_PER_DOC = 1000;
00040 
00041 static const size_t BITS_PER_BYTE = 8;
00042 
00043 //Max size permitted for the protobuffer msg
00044 //msgs are written as binary files in (size, msg)* format
00045 static const size_int MAX_MSG_SIZE = 10000000;
00046 
00047 //Interval for logging a status msg to INFO
00048 static const int PRT_CNT_INTERVAL = 50000;
00049 
00050 //Default value of alphabar
00051 static const double ALPHA_SUM = 50.;
00052 
00053 //Default value for beta
00054 static const double BETA = 0.01;
00055 
00056 //Default value for gamma
00057 static const double GAMMA = 0.01;
00058 
00059 //Default value for delta
00060 static const double DELTA = 0.01;
00061 
00062 //when alpha optimization is turned on, alphas
00063 //are always >= MIN_ALPHA
00064 static const double MIN_ALPHA = 0.01;
00065 
00066 static const word_t NUM_WORDS_PER_TOP = 20;
00067 
00068 static const word_t NUM_TOPICS_PER_DOC = 10;
00069 
00070 static const word_t MAX_MSGS = 10;
00071 
00072 //The number of Random Number Generators(RNGs)
00073 //used to simulate one RNG per thread behaviour
00074 //as TBB does not allow thread local state. We
00075 //create NUM_RNGS RNGs and access one of them
00076 //pseudo-randomly
00077 static const uint16_t NUM_RNGS = 32;
00078 
00079 //Used as the mask instead of mod operator
00080 static const uint16_t RNG_MASK = (1 << 5) - 1;
00081 
00082 //Max allowed memory size. If you try allocating
00083 //more than this we will abort
00084 static const uint64_t MAX_MEMORY_USAGE = ((uint64_t) 1) << 34;
00085 
00086 //If you try allocating more than this much memory,
00087 //you will be warned that there might be something
00088 //going wrong. If you are using a very large data set
00089 //this is expected
00090 static const uint32_t WARN_MEMORY_SIZE = 1 << 31;
00091 
00092 //Max number of attempts before we give up on
00093 //acquiring a lock. This is relevant for the
00094 //multi-machine code
00095 static const uint16_t LOCK_MAX_TRIES = 60;
00096 
00097 //This is the maximum number of attempts before
00098 //we give up on waiting for all clients to init.
00099 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00100 static const uint16_t INIT_COM_MAX_TRIES = 60;
00101 
00102 //Expiry time in secs for the lock set on memcached
00103 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00104 static const time_t LOCK_EXPIRY_TIME = 10; //in secs
00105 
00106 //This is a multiplier used with the LOCK_EXPIRY_TIME
00107 //when we try to reacquire a lock
00108 //This is relevant for the multi-machine code
00109 static const uint16_t REACQUIRE_BUFFER = 2;
00110
